titleStmt.title: Regulations for the transport of grain

revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: Year 2. (At Kerkeosiris), which is unguarded and is not situated on the great river nor on any other navigable stream, and is 160 stades distant from Ptolemais Euergetis the metropolis of the nome and 159 stades from Moiris, where there is a guarded point nearby, the grain is collected and conveyed to the royal granary in the village, 3 artabas measured (as extra payment) on every 100 artabas for cleansing and sifting, 2 artabas for extra measure. It is transported from there by pack animals to � in the Herakleopolite (nome) � to Alexandria �, 8 artabas on every 100 for � the village ... (Here the papyrus breaks off.)
